title: Foxit PhantomPDF Update Service Incorrect Permission Assignment Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Foxit PhantomPDF. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of the configuration files used by the Foxit PhantomPDF Update Service. The issue results from incorrect permissions set on a resource used by the service. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Foxit has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.foxitsoftware.com/support/security-bulletins.php
timeline:
2020-06-19 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-09-29 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2020-10-09 - Advisory Updated
credit: Mat Powell of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative
